page.title: 01Worbarrow Bay
page.content: This block lies entirely within the bounds of the army's Lulworth tank range and includes the beautiful Worbarron Bay. Half of the block (southern) is taken up by the English Channel. The long ridge of the Purbeck Hills reaches its western end in Worbarrow Bay (square 3). Apart from the rough grazing of cattle in squares 12 & 4 by local farmers, the area is deserted and quite without amenities. There are no roads and public access is limited to the coast path which is opened only at weekends and during August by the army. The deserted village of Tyneham lies just outside square 4 (to the east).
